articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mediator Qatar has handed Israel and Hamas a "final" draft of a ceasefire and hostage release agreement designed to end the war in Gaza, an official briefed on the negotiations told Reuters on Monday.
articles.title: Qatar hands Israel, Hamas 'final' draft of Gaza ceasefire deal, official tells Reuters

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich described the deal taking shape as "a catastrophe" for Israel's security.
articles.title: Angry hostage families harangue Israeli hardliner Smotrich

articles.author: Joey Roulette
articles.description: Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin prepared for the inaugural launch of its New Glenn rocket from Florida early on Monday, nearing a pivotal debut in Earth orbit that will mark a major step towards a long-awaited goal of competing with Elon Musk's SpaceX in the satellite launch market.
articles.title: Bezos' Blue Origin prepares for debut New Glenn rocket launch

articles.author: Ahmed Kingimi
articles.description: Suspected Islamist militants killed 40 farmers in an attack on the Dumba community in Nigeria's Borno State on Sunday, a senior state official said on Monday.
articles.title: At least 40 farmers killed in Nigeria's Borno state, govt says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Six member states of the European Union have called for the bloc to temporarily suspend sanctions on Syria in areas such as transport, energy and banking, according to a paper seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Six EU nations call for temporary Syria sanctions relief

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuela attorney general Tarek Saab said on Monday his office has requested an arrest warrant and Interpol notice against opposition figure Leopoldo Lopez, who spent years in detention in Venezuela but has lived in Spain for several years.
articles.title: Venezuela AG requests warrant, Interpol notice against opposition figure living abroad

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: "There will undoubtedly be more," he said.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says he's ready to exchange N. Korean soldiers for Ukrainians held in Russia

articles.author: Eltayeb Siddig
articles.description: Civilians and soldiers celebrated in Wad Madani, the capital of Sudan's El Gezira state, after it was recaptured by the Sudanese army from the paramilitary Rapid Support Services, marking a possible turning point in a devastating near two-year civil war.
articles.title: Celebrations in Sudan's Wad Madani as army takes over strategic city

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas said on Monday that talks over some core issues for a ceasefire deal in Gaza have made progress, an official in the Palestinian group told Reuters.
articles.title: Hamas says talks over some core issues for Gaza ceasefire made progress

articles.author: Anne Kauranen
articles.description: Crew on board an oil tanker accused of sabotaging undersea power and communications cables in the Baltic Sea were poised to cut other cables and pipelines when Finnish authorities boarded the vessel last month, the head of the Finnish investigation said.
articles.title: Oil tanker sabotage crew were poised to cut more cables when caught, Finland says
